utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Do you want a lean body for summer? Well, the time to start is now. No gimmicks, no crash diets, and absolutely no drugs. Think healthy and be healthy. You can start now. Just pick up the phone and become the best you you can be.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Cut! Going again.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Sorry, did I mess up the commercial?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: No, it's fine. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Ah, I think it's cramps. Oh, I have burning on my side.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Sit down, take a few minutes, and catch your breath. Everybody else keep running!

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: We're not filming.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: We don't do this for the cameras. We do it for ourselves.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: We can't go again with him sitting there.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Fine, um, but that felt phony. At least let me get a little workout. Maybe if I’m breathing as hard as they are, I won't seem like such an evil task master.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: All right, take five, guys.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: How you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: I think I’m ready to do this.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: You sure? That's it. That's the way to fight through. All right, concentrate on those knees. Lean into it. And lift.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Lifting.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Come on, push it!

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Lifting.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Come on, you're almost at the top. Those eight steps are the difference between fat and thin. Seven, six, five, four! One more! Nice job! You feel that burn? That's your body carving out its new shape.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Don't sit. Just take it slow on the way down.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Oh, boy. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Any idea why we're getting half as many requests for you as usual?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Democrats' health care plan?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: At least we have one case that looks intriguing. 30-year-old fitness trainer suddenly can't breathe. Collapses and breaks her ankle. That's it? You're not gonna argue why this case is beneath you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No point. I'm in an elevator. Can't run away.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You can't run away anyway.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's just mean. Why are we still together?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We are going to our office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pronoun confusion. Starts kicking in once you pass child-bearing age.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, that's just mean. My office was recently destroyed. I thought I’d use the office of the doctor directly responsible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think the patient holding the gun to my head was actually the one directly responsible.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My desk won't fit in his cell. You can use our outer office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where's Foreman and Thirteen?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Down in the GRC. Thirteen started her clinical trials today.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What's Cuddy doing in your office?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Other than throwing off the feng shui with her ass that faces all eight sides of the bagua at once?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: These walls aren't soundproof.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm well aware. Normal CT means that her lung problem has the distinction of having nothing to do with her lungs.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Steroids. No one looks this fit without cheating. Anabolic steroids hack away at the immune system, left her open to a pulmonary infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Muscles and curves. My penis is so confused.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She's not on steroids. Her program's all about getting in shape naturally — exercising, eating right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you know this because?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She has infomercials to sell her DVDs. What? I'm up late a lot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you actually believe what you see on TV. Go run the labs.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The labs are back. And there's no sign of steroid use. Can someone please read her file?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can someone please stop backseat differentialating?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What about allergies? She goes jogging every morning. Inhales car fumes during rush hour.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Perfect, except that she was jogging half a mile from the nearest road. In the cold. Cold air hits the lungs, sets off an attack. Exercise-induced asthma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice try. Except EIA doesn't account for the elevated BP, if you'd read the file. Come on. Before the shrieking harpy melts my brain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Her BP's fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Exercise-induced asthma actually fits.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. You know. She can't know.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The only good way to test for EIA is to recreate the conditions in which the attack occurred. But we can't exactly make her run out in the cold on a broken ankle.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get creative.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Any shortness of breath? Tightness in your chest?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Feeling pretty good actually.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Not even breathing hard. O2 stats and lung capacity are still well within range.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your cuff's slipping down. You want to stop for a moment?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: I'd rather not. Haven't had any exercise in two days.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Take it you don't get a lot of fat in your diet.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: I take it from your tone you think that's a bad thing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Do you ever indulge?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Ha. There's more to life than indulging your every whim.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I didn't say every. But a whim every now and then can make life a little —

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You okay? Trouble breathing?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: No, I feel fine. Why?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No pulse. This isn't asthma.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There a lot of other people in the trial?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm taking over the people that already started it at Mercy. So pretty full. Stop. One more time. No talking.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I shouldn't be here. It's nepotism. I know the guy running the drug trials, so I get a spot.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You have Huntington’s, so you get a spot. Stop. One more time. Just the fingers. No mouth.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The point of this thing is to improve neural cell longevity. Which doesn't matter much before symptoms. So you should give my spot to someone —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Shut up. Stop. You can stop feeling guilty. Your best tapping rate was .004 taps per millisecond. Means your nerves have started degenerating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You wanna work in here? Fine. Me too. We'll split the desk, 50-50. That side's yours. This side's mine.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're right. There's plenty of space here. Neither one of us needs all of it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So that's your strategy. Taking the high road. It's not gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Huh? Did you say something? I couldn't hear you from all the way over here on my side of the desk.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patient's heart stopped.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: We shocked her back to sinus rhythm. She's stable. Test didn't set it off. Her EKG was normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, she's consistent. The lung problems had nothing to do with her lungs. A heart problem that has nothing to do with her heart. Something is strangling her system.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Carcinoid tumor?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Find it, cut it out.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Can a leaking breast implant cause joint pain?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. And she clearly doesn't have implants. Or joint pain. What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Got another patient. I set up an online second opinion clinic. People who don't like or trust their doctors e-mail symptoms. I can knock off four or five cases over lunch. Clear two grand by e-mailing them back. Ascending colon's clean.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's got to be illegal.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Only in nine states, and this isn't one of them. Legal notice spells out it doesn't replace doctor's visits. So there's no opportunity for malpractice.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How come you haven't said anything about this?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: It's no big secret. I guess I’m just not very chatty.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You told us when you renewed your subscription to National Geographic.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Small intestine looks clean. Moving into the pylorus.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So you don't mind if I tell House?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Actually House may sort of mind because I sort of set it up in House's name. Nothing in the bile duct.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And by "set it up in his name," you mean?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I mean it's Dr. Gregory House's second opinion clinic with medical advice direct from Dr. Gregory House.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're insane. With two days to live.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: House is never gonna find out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He will if I tell him. Or you cut me in for 30% and I keep your secret safe.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: That's blackmail.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes. Moving into the — Whoa —

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: That's her stomach? It's the size of a shot glass.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Because our patient's a big, fat cheater.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Subtle. No way you geniuses could've spotted this.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Gastric bypass surgery. She had her stomach stapled. Then had the records from her files pulled so it wouldn't ruin their DVD sales.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hold on a second. Can you do this outside?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I could, but that would defeat the purpose of doing it here. Where are the smart guys?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If you mean Foreman and Thirteen, apparently the first appointment of the drug trial's an all-day thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said yes to this?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Her gastric bypass procedure could cause —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget the bypass. Treat her like a fat girl.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Should we treat her like a 60-year-old Asian man too? She's not fat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not on the outside. But on the inside, she's still tons of fun.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: When she was obese, she probably had type two diabetes. Could've left her with permanent nerve damage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ten points for doing what I said. Minus ten points for doing it badly. If this was diabetes-induced nerve damage, it would've kicked in years ago. Have you seen my balls?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can you hold on a second?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My balls. Have you seen my balls? Giant one and the red one.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your plan isn't gonna work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course it is. I try to make you miserable to make you leave. You deny that it's making you miserable. You try to make me miserable so I’ll stop making you miserable. And eventually you will leave, citing reasons that have nothing to do with misery.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're not bothering me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Step one complete.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm gonna call you from my cell. And then I will come back in here. Hey. Yeah, I just had to explain to him that I had his balls and he's not getting them back. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Sleep apnea explains —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apnea would've disappeared when she shrank.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not if it destroyed the musculature of her trachea.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Apnea cuts off oxygen to the brain. The resulting neurological damage —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She been snoring?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She didn't mention it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did she mention feeling tired after a full night's sleep?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: No, but —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This isn't apnea. And this is a stupid room to be doing a DDX in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cliff notes. Gastric bypass only makes her skinny on the outside. On the inside, we have heart and lung issues not caused by heart and lung issues.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Private area, House. It can wait.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You need to consider side effects from her gastric bypass surgery.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Forget the bypass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let the dying girl finish.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You said forget the —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tssss. Dr. Thirteen has the floor.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Bypass could create malabsorption issues. Leads to low potassium.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Very stupid. Her potassium's fine.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: But her intestines aren't. Gastric bypass could cause malabsorption by creating a blind loop of bowel. It ulcerates during exercise. Bacteria get loose in the bloodstream. Migrate to the heart and lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Very not stupid. Bacteria in the bowels means there's bacteria in the poop. Get some and test it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He could've come up with SIBO anywhere else in the hospital. You didn't need to come down here and screw with us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But her wrong idea led to his right one. It was vital screwing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We think your surgery might've caused an infection called SIBO. The stool test will help us to confirm. Put some of what you're full of in here.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: If surgery could somehow make you taller, wouldn't you do it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sure. But I wouldn't call a meeting of the Lollipop Guild and tell them they can grow if they work real hard at it.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: I don't tell anyone not to get gastric bypass. I tell them how to get healthy. How to improve their lives.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, by telling them to do what you were unwilling to.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: I was willing to do anything. Thyroid, hormones, crash diets — none of it worked. My body was like a prison. When I got the surgery, I got healthy. And when I got healthy, I got happy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not sure you're happy. But if you are, being healthy didn't do it. Being pretty did. Poop in the bedpan.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House's office? Really?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did he send you here to beg for it back?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, there are dozens of other doctors —

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Other doctors actually use their offices for crazy stuff like seeing patients. Not throwing a ball against the wall and calling it work.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's his process. That ball saves lives.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did he give you talking points?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, but I added one of my own. Don't take his office and pretend like all you're doing is taking his office. You chose his room because you want to be there. But sitting near him and hoping isn't gonna get it done.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Leave here now, or I’ll take your office.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, you won't.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: The boob lady e-mailed me again complaining of chronic fatigue now. She's convinced the implants are responsible.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They're not.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I told her. She says something is, and if I don't find out what she's gonna complain to the licensing board. It's not funny.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It is. You just can't appreciate it because it's gonna destroy your career.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What happened? He call Foreman "clean and articulate" again? It is surprising.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Clinic patients just whining.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's the poop?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: It's gonna take about an hour to spin down the sample.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are we looking for?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You don't know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm doing my famous Socrates impression. Think I really nailed the accent.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: High fat content indicates SIBO.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And what does fat do in water?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: It floats.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What else floats in water?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like I was wrong to dismiss apnea. You guys can stay up all night gloating in the sleep lab.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What about all that scar tissue around the implant? Could that be —

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That amount of encapsulation's perfectly normal.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Well, I gotta tell her something.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tell her to find a decent plastic surgeon who can correct the placement —

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Yeah, that's what she wants to hear, she's sick and she's lopsided.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tell her it's a virus. It probably is, and it'll get her off your back for a few — Emmy’s EEG is flatlining.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Where would she have gone?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Hey, I looked for you guys in the control room, but you seemed busy.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Get off there. Last time you exercised, you had a cardiac incident.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: I feel fine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You felt fine last time.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: I only slept a couple hours, but I feel great. Can I get one of those machines?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You're running on a broken ankle.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: It doesn't hurt.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And your leg is bleeding. You feel that?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Numbness in her left foot is ascending into her leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How did she manage to sneak out for a run?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She said she needed to use the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You two get the results of the sleep apnea test, or did those need to use the bathroom too?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Alpha waves on the EEG ruled it out.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I was mixing some hydrogen sulfide for good and valid reasons and must've spilled some on my side. Did it waft over to your side?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cunning plan. You do realize it’s gonna stink for hours — on both sides.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, would you look at the time? I hope your patient isn't still sick… Forcing you to stay here all night.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Ascending numbness means her nerves are breaking down.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or her brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or both.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We've gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Let me finish. I'll meet you down there.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You were 15 minutes late yesterday. I don't want you to develop bad habits.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Appreciate the life lesson, but 15 minutes give or take isn't gonna make a difference. Get started on your other patients. I'll be down there when we're done here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Way to know where your bread is buttered, sister. Up high!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If the problem's in her brain, it could be MS.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Or early onset Parkinson’s.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But if it's her nerves, it could be transverse myelitis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or a million other things. We're gonna stay in the dark until we can figure out if her electrical problem is in her power station or in the high-tension wires. Power station's the brain. Wires are the nerves. Go run an NCV test.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The test will measure the amount of time it'll take this electrical impulse to travel along your nerves.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Will it hurt?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. Give me your arm.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: You can ask nicely.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I learned at med school you don't actually cure with kindness.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: You're right. I'm a hypocrite. But I don't have a choice.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not really interested in your rationalizations.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: If I’m open about the gastric bypass, no one would listen to me anymore.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You mean no one would buy your DVDs.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: It's not about the DVD sales. I'm helping people. My clients are making themselves healthy. They're living better lives. Can you honestly tell me you've never done anything hypocritical? I'm sure you had good reasons.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Give me your arm… please? Keep your arm raised.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Does this mean something is wrong with my nerves?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. It's your muscles. We don't need to run this test. It's not what we thought.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She has muscle weakness. Could indicate myasthenia gravis.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Also could be some kind of toxin.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Excuse me, are you going up to the personnel floors?

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: I'm going to see Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Do you have an appointment with him?

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: We've been e-mailing. Joint pain and fatigue thanks to these.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I'm sure it's nothing.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: Oh, and now this.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: He's actually downstairs.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, gone. Gone for the day. But, uh, we work for him. We can set you up in the ER.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The antibiotics will make her feel better. She's outta here by morning.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: If it is a staph infection.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's gotta be. She has sleeves of tattoos and piercings from God knows where.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She has muscle weakness. Could indicate myasthenia gravis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I had the weirdest dream. You guys did the test in a reasonable amount of time and came back here before I had time to fall asleep. You guys still smell that?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Maybe you should just let her have your office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or… She sends one of yours to the hospital, send one of hers to the morgue. It's not myasthenia gravis. Her breathing's improving and the weakness is in her extremities.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Could be a botulinum reaction.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't think sabotaging your boss' office is a wise counterattack.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All that is needed for evil to succeed is for good men to do nothing.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She probably used a lot of botox to tighten up her skin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True. Could also be any kind of heavy metal toxicity. PSP or arsenic from eating too much seafood. Cadmium from bad bottled water. Lead or nickel from canned fruits or natural grains.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't think replacing that was part of the renovation plans.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It is now. Lucky for us, we can treat all those toxins with the same thing: chelation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You never showed up.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Get out of my house.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I wanted to find proof that you were slipping back into your self-destructive pattern. Confirm you weren't worth my time. Instead, I found this. You followed all of my instructions to the letter. Probably better than any patient I have. So why are you the only one who can't show up for appointments?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I came down right after I was finished with House. You were in your office with another patient. And there was another patient in the waiting room.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Janice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm well-aware of what's gonna happen to my body over the next eight to ten years. I do not need a visual reminder every time I walk into that place.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's understandable. It's human. And you need to get over it. Now you show up on time tomorrow, or you don't show up at all.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The chelation didn't work. Her muscles are still deteriorating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That rules out toxins. So what else can go wrong when the Hindenburg deflates?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why aren't we doing this in your office?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Obviously because it would be stupid to do this in an office with no furniture. Cuddy… overreacted to my overreaction.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Coronaro-cardiac fistula. Even a small hole could cause —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This started in the lungs, not the heart. And why are you leaning on a 45-degree angle away from Foreman?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sitting straight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Trouble in the land of false hope?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Everything is fine. Austrian syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice deflection. But our patient doesn't drink. She's a health nut. And even if I was a cynical guy and thought that she was a liar, I'd have done a tox screen, which would've come back negative for alcohol. You should come to these gatherings more often. Keep you from looking like an idiot. Are you making book, or did something else happen to our patient?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Personal. I'll put it on vibrate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Guillain-Barré. Usually starts as a muscle pain patients compare to the pain of over-exercising.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So who's paging you? Your wife? Does it worry you that she paged Kutner first?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Guillain-Barré fits. Patient didn't notice the initial symptoms because it's no different than how she feels every day. Her muscle weakness is the precursor to full paralysis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gastric bypass probably set it off. Oh, at what price beauty? Go start her on plasmapheresis.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: She put de lime in de coconut. She drank it all up. She put de lime in de coconut. She drank it all up.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: DeeDee.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: She put de lime in de coconut. She drank it all up.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Can you stop singing?

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: She put de lime in de coconut, call de doctor, woke him up an’ say.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Musical automatism. She could be having a partial seizure right now. You need to get House.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: Doctor! Ain't der notin I can take, I say

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: DeeDee!

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: Doctor! To relieve my bellyache, I say

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yelling at her is not going to be an effective treatment.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She's faking. It's a cry for attention.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: Doctor! She put de lime in de coconut

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Her brain could be misfiring.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: She call de doctor, woke him up.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Right, a rare neurological disorder is far more likely than a cry for attention. I mean, nothing about this woman screams "look at me."

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: I say Doctor! Ain’t der notin I can take, I say

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: On the other hand, look at her. She needs a full neurological work-up.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: Doctor! To relieve my bellyache. I say Doctor!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Get House!

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Ultimate irony. Killed myself trying to make myself healthy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're not dying, okay? This disease is manageable.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Better start getting used to that wheelchair. Self-pity doesn't suit you.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Just take me down to the —

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. You're strong enough to walk. Come on, get your ass out of bed and walk.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Could be an aneurysm. We've got to control her blood pressure. Start her on a calcium channel blocker.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Or… you could tell House.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I can't tell House.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You'll be in trouble. On the other hand, she's sick.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She's singing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And bleeding out of her ears, and losing her hair. And an aneurysm doesn't explain her joint pain.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Wilson's disease does.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No Kayser-Fleischer rings.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Anorexia.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Now you're just desperate.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Biliary tumor causing paraneoplastic syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That might actually fit. I'll scan to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You'd do that for me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You don't have the time. Which means I can ask for 25% of your income and you'll give it to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You going over the fence?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Took three visits, but I finally convinced the contractor that I’m Cuddy's boss. And all the office renovation plans need to go through me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You did do the math on this, right? Screwing with her office means her renovations will take longer. Means she will be in your office longer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See there? I'm having a bidet put in instead of a toilet. Not in addition to. Instead of. You want to know what happened to the old toilet?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She'll be with you where you claim to not want her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I smashed it with a sledgehammer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think in some ancient cultures that was actually considered a proposal of marriage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is this fun for you? Analyzing everyone else's fun away?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ask her out. It'll cost the hospital a lot less.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I brought some visitors. Cheer you up. It's okay. Come on in, guys.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: We're all staying on your plan. Nobody's cheating.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: That's great. Uh, you're on my arm.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: We found out about your gastric bypass. How could you lie to us like that?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: The doctors told you? You're really hurting my arm.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: You're not the best you you can be. You're a fraud. You're a self-hating fat person.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: You're really hurting me.

utterance.speaker: Irv
utterance.content: Feel the burn.

utterance.speaker: Other Visitors
utterance.content: Burn! Burn!

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Help! Get off of me! Get off of me! Get off of me!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Mood congruent hallucinations.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Means it's not Guillain-Barré.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Which means whatever it is, it's now in her brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sorry. Treatment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does Foreman schedule your appointments by numbers on the clock or just by when I’m in the middle of something?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sorry if I’m dying at a bad time for you. Could be CNS lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So losing the 200 pounds was just a coincidence?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about a prion disease?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If her brain is slowly turning into a Swiss cheese, there's not a lot we can do.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are some possible treatments.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get a brain biopsy to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're not cutting into this woman's brain before you test.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is the test.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not for CNS lymphoma, which is a perfectly legitimate diagnosis. One you can test for non-invasively.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're obviously not opposed to being invasive.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Rule out CNS lymphoma first. Then rule out astrocytoma, then rule out other brain tumors…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hereby declare them ruled out.

utterance.speaker: Cudddy
utterance.content: Run the tests. You can do a brain biopsy, but only as a last resort.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start running down Cuddy's list of diseases it's not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not stopping me for medical reasons. You're stopping me… because you have the hots for me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're still here because you have the hots for me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Evidenced by the fact that I’m the one who moved into your office.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's the biggest office. And I’m not the one that destroyed —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you dressed like that? Why do you try so hard to get my attention? Are you screwing with me?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you screwing with me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That depends on your answer.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Everybody knows this is going somewhere. I think we're supposed to kiss now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We already did that. It seemed like the logical next step.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Really? I'm an idiot for being surprised.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can you leave these?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'll keep coming, but can you change my appointment time?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Can't. Schedule's full. You're stuck with her. Might as well get to know her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your head MRI was clean. Means you don't have CNS lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: What's next on the list?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Other types of brain tumors.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Can we stop at the cafeteria?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can have something brought up for you. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Chocolate cake.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You can't give up. We're gonna figure this out.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: What am I supposed to be hoping for? That you find a brain tumor? What else could it be? You were so hard on me about lying. How about you take some of your own advice and tell me the truth? What's next on the list?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Prion disease.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: And if that's what I got, how bad?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are a few treatments, but there's no guarantee. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: And you won't let me have a piece of cake?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, where's Cuddy? It's not CNS lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's getting worse. You want me to find Cuddy and get her approval for the brain biopsy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When you were philandering with impunity, how did that feel?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Superficially, I loved it. But deep down, I think I was miserable. Why? What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You weren't miserable. You gave something away to make a relationship work. You rationalize that you're getting something back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay, I’m gonna go get Cuddy's approval for the brain biopsy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Leave 'em there. I'm gonna do the biopsy myself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cuddy wanted us to eliminate seven different things.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cuddy doesn't always get what she wants.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Bad idea to get into a power play with somebody who has the power.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're fired. Just reinforcing your point.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Whatever personal drama you're playing out, you'd be a lot smarter to —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thought you said she was sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sick people don't spontaneously get better.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes, they do. It's called an immune system.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sick people who are sick enough to make it to me don't spontaneously get better. Not as pithy, but yeah, technically more accurate. What's the last thing you gave her?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I took her for an MRI looking for —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: MRIs detect. They don't treat. What did you give her after the MRI?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I didn't give her anything. She got depressed at the lack of direction. We went to the cafeteria for some chocolate cake. Took her to her room, hung a banana bag, let her rest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You gave her cake.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She asked for it. I figured —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You figured you'd let me play 20 questions instead of just telling me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Feeling crappy again? I brought your cure. I'd give you an IV of this stuff, but the frosting tends to get stuck in the little tubes.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Is this a joke?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not a joke. Not a lie. Not an attempt to defraud in any way. It's an actual licensed physician with an actual diagnosis. Hereditary coproporphyria. Your face is genetically blessed. Your body chemistry is slightly less so. Doesn't make enough of a certain enzyme that I can't pronounce, but it's apparently important for your liver and everything else. Treatment is a high carb diet rich in sugar. When you were a porker, you were self-medicating.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: So this is treatable.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We just have to reverse your gastric bypass and get you back on a high carb, glucose-enriched diet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The best you you could be is a lot more you. Open the hangar. Here comes the plane.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: There's nothing else you can try?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. There's a drug that manages the symptoms, but it's not a cure.

utterance.speaker: Emmy
utterance.content: Let's try that.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You don't want to have the surgery?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Understand. There's not many people who have the guts to admit they'd rather be pretty than healthy. The income's better and you get more action. I'll start you on your drug treatment right away.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I bought it. I bought that it was really about trying to make people's lives a little better.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You're surprised she's superficial? You're a plastic surgeon. This is the human condition.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, she's a freak.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Every time you put someone under to bob their nose, you were risking their life.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: No singing. She's better.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: No one was supposed to let my patient leave her bed.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: She had a respiratory arrest. We coded her nearly 20 minutes, but she didn't make it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House is an unemotional child incapable of intimacy or romance. Trust me, it's done. It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I like the desk. Lot of character.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's not the one I ordered. This is my desk from med school.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have it in storage or something?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My mom did.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That was sweet of her to do that.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She didn't. My mom has no idea I’m redoing my office.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I lied to you the other night. That woman in the waiting room, she didn't freak me out about my future. She freaked me out about my past.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your mother. Must've been horrible watching her die.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I wanted her to die. She just… yelled so much. And for no reason. Just screamed at me in front of my friends. My father tried to explain to me that her brain was literally shrinking, that she didn't mean it. That it was the disease, but I didn't care. I hated her. I never said good-bye. And she died with me hating her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Did Chase test for the biliary tumor?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Said it was negative. Said she was stable when he left her. Should've found more time. We should've —

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House is gonna kill us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Slowly. And painfully. You're not only idiots, you're frauds. Fraudulent idiots. Fraudulent idiotic killers, as it turns out.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: House, this was really my —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your fault? Yeah! For pretending to be me when you're not even competent. And your fault for not ratting him out while the patient was still alive. What she had was easily treatable. She could've been fine. Damn treatment's so simple. Might still be possible.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: House… House, she's clearly dead.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She was dead.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She wasn't dead. She wasn't even sick, you moron. Seriously, how good was she? No formal training. At least not in acting.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: Did you see their faces?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think we may have an anal hygiene violation there.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So the CT.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was from a patient three years ago. It was hard to find. But the hair and make-up, getting Chase and Cameron to play along, much easier.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: We deserved it. I'll take down the website before —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take it down? Are you kidding? It's way too lucrative to shut it down. For Chase, for me. I earn 50% for letting you use my name. Chop chop. Go to work. First dollars go to expenses. I booked our little thespian here for two full days. That's three G's I owe her.

utterance.speaker: DeeDee
utterance.content: And you still got 3 hours left.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do I?
